title: Need help on a laptop that runs League.
body: Hi, my desktop just died and i wanted to get a laptop so i have something portable and on the go. I was wondering if anyone could suggest a good laptop for under $1500 Australian dollars i could get that has a reliable 60fps and doesn't overheat. Laptop screen size doesn't really matter and neither does storage space. It would help out alot.

replies.body:
Here's What I personally use, and it runs League of legends perfectly fine with G Sync and V Sync at 75Fps on 1920x1080 full maximum graphics.
https://www.amazon.com/G752VT-DH72-Gaming-Laptop-Nvidia-GeForce/dp/B01578ZN0Q/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1470905755&sr=8-1&keywords=asus+g752+vt
Nice thanks so much, I'm not really familiar with any good places to buy computers/laptops from could you suggest any?

How ya goin' TheShinDigs?

While I can't suggest a specific laptop, I can tell you that the salespeople at your local computer shops can probably make a quality suggestion. My mates out in Queensland and South Australia have had great luck in getting hardware and PC recommendations from their shops, and a lot of the salespeople play League, funnily enough. 

The official minimum and recommended specs can be found [here.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements/) Let me know if you have any questions, best of luck with your new PC! :)
